results.title: Eraserhead
results.creator_credit: David Lynch, Lynch/Frost Productions and American Film Institute
results.brief_description: Lynch’s debut film has been re-released with a new print and stereo mix soundtrack. Opinion is divided as to film’s brilliance but over the years it has achieved cult status in it’s genre. Shot in black and white with an incredible soundtrack and tight script, ‘Eraserhead’ is the story of a timid printer Henry Spencer (John Nance) who lives in an apartment building trying to figure out what to do with his horribly mutated son. Lynch described the film as ” a dream of dark and troubling things.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Lynch, Lynch/Frost Productions and American Film Institute

results.title: Eradicate the enemy
results.creator_credit: Mushir Ahmad, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: Advocates the popularising of the BCG vaccine to fight tuberculosis. BCG or Bacillus Calmette Guerin was developed at the Pasteur Institute in Paris after many years of research. It was first tested on human beings in 1921 and proved an inexpensive, speedy and effective method for the prevention and eradication of tuberculosis.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mushir Ahmad, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India

results.title: ERA : the Educational Reform Association School (TEFC)
results.brief_description: This film gives an impression of the philosophies, day-to-day experiences and development of pupils at the Education Reform Association School at Donvale, Victoria. Students and staff together discuss the aims of the school programme, hopefully providing evidence for greater freedom in all our educational institutions

results.title: Equus
results.creator_credit: Sidney Lumet, Lester Persky, Elliott Kastner, Denis Holt and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Peter Firth plays Alan Strang, a young man working as a stableboy at an upper-class riding school who one night brutally blinds the horses. Richard Burton is psychiatrist Dr. Martin Dysart who is investigating the reasons for the young man’s apparent senseless crime. Based on Peter Shaffer’s acclaimed play, “Equus” is a film that explores and manages to traverse a rich field of themes and concerns: psychoanalysis and mythology; sexuality and repression; class and family; sex and power. The relationship between analyst and patient becomes increasingly complex as the mysteries of the boy’s repressions become unravelled. The men’s exchanges begin to be complicated by the echoes of homoeroticism and the psychological overtones of the Oedipal Complex. Though dominated by the performances of Burton and Firth, “Equus” features an excellent supporting cast including Joan Plowright, Eileen Atkins and Jenny Agutter. Initially dividing critics, “Equus” has become a cult favourite through the years and is acknowledged as one of Lumet’s darker and innovative works.

results.title: Equality. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Art Ciocco, Paul Buck, Ken Stein, New Jersey Public Television and Best Films
results.brief_description: Explores the diversity of people and the breadth of the problems as one searches for “equality”. Concentrates on the basic areas of economics, ethnic groups, problems of old age and alternate lifestyle. Contains some b&w sequences.

results.title: Equal to the task
results.brief_description: This film show many of the tasks carried out by the Royal Australian Army Service Corps, including transportation, handling and supply of rations, in despatch of supplies, supply of petrol by most modern methods and training of army cooks.

results.title: Equal opportunity tapes
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Cockram and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Emphasises the importance of equal opportunity to both male and female teachers. Tape 1. Introduces and defines the concept of equal opportunity. 2. Designed to show what the real world is about for women. 3. Attempts to encourage teachers to examine, analyse and consider altering their classroom practice.

results.title: Epstein
results.creator_credit: Henry Cooper, Alan Harper and Campbell Harper Films
results.brief_description: A record of the Memorial Exhibition held in Edinburgh in 1961 of the work of Sir Jacob Epstein. Traces the development of his work and shows many of his well-known pieces - portraits of his family, of children, of many public figures, as well as his powerful symbolic figures including Lucifer, the forerunner to his St Michael on Coventry Cathedral.
